Content:: The pterygoid fossa is an anatomical term for the fossa formed by the divergence of the lateral pterygoid plate and the medial pterygoid plate of the sphenoid bone. The lateral and medial pterygoid plates (of the pterygoid process of the sphenoid bone) diverge behind and enclose between them a V-shaped fossa, the pterygoid fossa. This fossa faces posteriorly, and contains the medial pterygoid muscle and the tensor veli palatini muscle. This article incorporates text in the public domain from page 151 of the 20th edition of Gray's Anatomy (1918)  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
